text: Dilesi railway station () is a railway station outside the town of Dilesi, in Boeotia, Greece. It is owned by OSE, but service are provided by TrainOSE, through Proastiakos from Athens to Chalcis.Proastiakos timetable 2020 ==History== The station opened on 6 April 2005. In 2014 a disabled ramp was installed to improve access to the platforms. ==Service== The station is served by Proastiakos, with frequent services to Athens, Oinoi and Chalcis. ==Station layout== {|table border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=3 |style="border-bottom:solid 1px gray;" width=50 valign=top|Ground level |style="border-bottom:solid 1px gray;" width=100 valign=top| |style="border- bottom:solid 1px gray;" width=285 valign=top|Exit |- |style="border- bottom:solid 2px gray;" rowspan=3 valign=top|Level Ε1 |style="border-top:solid 1px gray;border-right:solid 2px gray;border- left:solid 2px gray;border-bottom:solid 2px gray;" colspan=2| Side platform, doors will open on the right/left |- |style="border-bottom:solid 1px gray;"|Platform 1Α |style="border-bottom:solid 1px gray;"|→ towards (Agios Georgios) → |- |style="border-bottom:solid 1px gray;"|platform 1Β |style="border-bottom:solid 1px gray;"|→ towards (Oinoi) ← |} ==References== Category:Transport in Boeotia Category:Railway stations in Central Greece Category:Railway stations opened in 2005
title: Dilesi railway station
